file_content.text: We truly appreciate your help.
We'll look forward to hearing your results.
...Yes, sir, the security codes all checked out--it's Lurker.
Blast it! How could that old fool let this happen? This is the last thing we need.
Oh--apologies, my lord. We're just handling a, uh... small threat to our plans' secrecy in one of the Makeb settlements. C--certainly nothing worthy of your concern.
The Emperor's Wrath does not ignore threats to the Empire.
Any problem is my concern.
The Empire's day-to-day struggles are no less important to the Dark Council than any other matter.
Any problem is my concern.
If there's good money, then it's worthy of me. What's the problem?
Maybe I could help, then.
I'm certainly concerned about it. What's going on?
This sounds serious to me.
Ah--a hunter! Finally, some good luck. We've uncovered a threat to our operation's secrecy in one of the Makeb settlements. We need your skills.
Just tell me what you're after, and I'll tell you the rate.
My skills are available.
Oh--Commander, it's good you've come. An issue has come up in one of the Makeb settlements--a threat to the secrecy of our operation. Can you help?
If there is a threat to our operation, I will deal with it personally.
I'll handle this.
Oh, uh, of course, my lord. We would welcome your expertise.
The Dark Council wouldn't want to see this operation fail. How can we address the matter?
What needs to be done?
My lord! I--I'm quite certain we can avoid any... unpleasantness if we can neutralize the potential leak quickly enough.
If you need a hand, my discretion can be guaranteed--for the right price.
How much help do you need?
A hunter of your legendary skills may be just what this operation needs.
Is this a technical threat or a matter of personnel?
Of course.
So far as we know, the threat is limited to personnel.
I wasn't aware that members of your species were serving in the military.
A Cathar soldier?
You're representing your people, Captain. Mistakes don't make good first impressions.
Are all aliens this inept?
N--no, of course not. I'm sure this threat can be neutralized before any damage is done.
Fool.
Fool.
Secrecy is the key to the entire plan! How could you let something like this happen?
I--I'm very sorry. We were only working with the resources we were given.
The issue is a retired Intelligence asset, code-name "Lurker." He's lived on Makeb for years, so we asked him to reactivate when we arrived.
The information he's provided has been instrumental in our operations, but the Hutts have caught on to his activities. Their mercenaries are tracking Lurker down as we speak.
How do we make sure we find him first?
And we can't let them succeed.
How was your agent's cover blown?
How did this happen?
If this spy is any good, he should know better than to be taken alive.
Death is his best option.
Lurker's been a solid asset so far, but he's been retired for a long time. We can't be sure he's still that... dedicated.
The mercenaries are using special bioscanners to track him down, following hairs, skin cells and so on. If you... appropriate one of the scanners, you can do the same.
We'll get what we need and wipe out our competition at the same time.
Perfect.
As for Lurker himself... whether we're better off bringing him back or neutralizing him--I'll leave that to your judgment.
Greetings.
The Lurker has been neutralized.
Your reputation is well deserved. This has all been very... educational, for all of us.
Please... let me assure you, no mistake like this will happen under my watch again.
Fail again, and you'll pay for it. Just like Lurker.
It better not.
Lurker and his family have reported in?
They have. All arrangements are made for the family's relocation to Dromund Kaas, and we've already got Lurker notating tactical positions with the scout teams.
And... I assure you, nothing like this will ever happen again on my watch. Ever.
If we're through here, I'm sure we all have important things to get to.
Carry on, then.
Yes, of course. Good luck to you.
Yes, fine, you're sorry. Just get back to work.
Stop groveling.
I don't care what you do, kid, long as I get paid.
What do I care?
I... I'll just return to my duties, then.
The Lurker is only alive because he can still be useful. Keep that in mind.
It better not.
I--I understand.
We believe they must have detected his transmissions--they're jamming them now. It's why we don't know for sure where Lurker's gone into hiding.
Unfortunately, the Hutts are jamming the Lurker's usual frequency, so we aren't sure where he's gone into hiding.
I'm sure they'll be no match for you.
I suppose we just have to make the best of the situation.
It will have to do.
We're in a bad way if all we can do is copy the Hutts' ideas.... So be it.
What a pitiful plan.
I'm sorry, but I really don't see any faster way of handling the situation.
Give me the mercenaries' last known location, and we'll get started.
Very well.
I'll have to see whether the man can still be useful.
It all depends.
I hope so. He's been very useful so far.
The faster we clean up this mess, the better.
Let's get this over with.
Ahem... apologies, again.
Good hunting.
It's rare to run into members of our species serving the Empire. I'm glad I could help.
Happy to help a fellow Cathar.
I can only hope to one day represent our people as well as you do, my lord. Thank you.
If not for you, I doubt I'd still be serving with the Empire at all. Thank you.
I've never encountered a fellow Cathar serving in the military.
A Cathar soldier?
Yes, recent... events have allowed more non-humans to enlist--when our loyalty is unquestioned. Hopefully, our contributions will create similar opportunities for others.
